FuncDef:
The radius-server coa-request hw-policy-name daa same-policy reply-ack command enables a device to reply with an ACK message when the RADIUS server uses a CoA message's HW-Policy-Name (26-95) attribute to deliver the same DAA service policy as that configured on the device in uniform accounting scenarios.
The undo radius-server coa-request hw-policy-name daa same-policy reply-ack command restores the default configuration.
By default, a device is enabled to reply with an NAK message when the RADIUS server uses a CoA message's HW-Policy-Name (26-95) attribute to deliver the same DAA service policy as that configured on the device in uniform accounting scenarios.
CLIs: radius-server coa-request hw-policy-name daa same-policy reply-ack
undo radius-server coa-request hw-policy-name daa same-policy reply-ack
Examples: [~HUAWEI] radius-server coa-request hw-policy-name daa same-policy reply-ack
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a uniform accounting scenario, if the HW-Policy-Name (26-95) attribute name that the RADIUS server uses a CoA message to deliver is the same as the DAA service policy name in a domain, the device replies with an NAK message. To enable the device to reply with an ACK message in this scenario, run the radius-server coa-request hw-policy-name daa same-policy reply-ack command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
